ygData.subject: Re: Hardware
ygData.msgSnippet: I play on a laptop: P4 1.19GHz, 512MB RAM, GeoForce2Go video card, Windows XP. I have a TERRIBLE lag in Bazaar, and sometimes in PoK. You guys think I should
ygData.messageBody:
I play on a laptop: P4 1.19GHz, 512MB RAM, GeoForce2Go video card,
Windows XP. I have a TERRIBLE lag in Bazaar, and sometimes in PoK.
You guys think I should upgrade my video card? I know Sony doesn't
support playing on a laptop, but aside from the lag in those two
areas, it's working quite well.

--- In EverQuest@yahoogroups.com, "Wulfric Rennison" <wulftech@e...>
wrote:
> So this is just a question to find out what kind of hardware you
use to run EverQuest. I suppose a Ps/2 counts as well since you can
technically run a version of EQ on it, but I was more curious as to
everyone's computers.
>
> Me, personally, I have two accounts. I have two PCs I run EQ on.
One PC is a PIII 1.2Ghz with 1GB of PC133 SDRAM, a 128MB ATI Radeon
4X AGP card, a SB Live! Gamer audio card with digital audio out, a
set of Creative FPS2000 4 point surround sound speakers, and a 19"
flat screen Samsung monitor. Great sound and great graphics, but
lags a little on Luclin and the newer zones.
>
> the second system is a P4 1.6Ghz with 640MB of PC133 SDRAM, a 64MB
ATI Radeon 4X AGP card, and using the onboard AC97 sound for the time
being. It does do digital audio out, but I only have a set of old
Labtec speakers. Also, the monitor is a 17" Gateway E200 monitor.
>
> I use Roadrunner cable to connect so it all works pretty well. I
don't plan on upgrading the PIII any more, but I will make more
changes to the P4. I plan on putting it up to a full gig and a half
of RAM and upgrading to a 128MB video card and a SoundBlaster Audigy
card. So when I get the money as they say... :) Hopefully next
month!
>
> Anyway, that's what I use.
>
> Wulfric
